private_information: I am a truck named truck0
My speed is 8 (units of distance per time)
I can drive between places; while driving I am not at any place
I can carry crates only when crates are loaded into me by a hoist
I cannot load or unload crates by myself
truck0.goal: Help achieve the global objective of arranging crates as specified in the environment goal.

private_information: I am a truck named truck1
My speed is 8 (units of distance per time)
I can drive between places; while driving I am not at any place
I can carry crates only when crates are loaded into me by a hoist
I cannot load or unload crates by myself
truck1.goal: Help achieve the global objective of arranging crates as specified in the environment goal.

private_information: I am a hoist named hoist0
My power is 4 (affects loading/unloading duration = weight / power)
I remain at a place; I cannot drive between places
I can lift, put down, load into truck, and unload from truck following temporal constraints
Lifting or putting down pure movement lasts 1 time unit; load/unload use weight/power durations
hoist0.goal: Help achieve the global objective of arranging crates as specified in the environment goal.

private_information: I am a hoist named hoist1
My power is 5 (affects loading/unloading duration = weight / power)
I remain at a place; I cannot drive between places
I can lift, put down, load into truck, and unload from truck following temporal constraints
Lifting or putting down pure movement lasts 1 time unit; load/unload use weight/power durations
hoist1.goal: Help achieve the global objective of arranging crates as specified in the environment goal.

private_information: I am a hoist named hoist2
My power is 6 (affects loading/unloading duration = weight / power)
I remain at a place; I cannot drive between places
I can lift, put down, load into truck, and unload from truck following temporal constraints
Lifting or putting down pure movement lasts 1 time unit; load/unload use weight/power durations
hoist2.goal: Help achieve the global objective of arranging crates as specified in the environment goal.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate trucks and hoists to produce a PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global crate stacking goals while respecting temporal/duration constraints and agent capabilities.

public_information: There are 3 places: depot0, distributor0, distributor1
Trucks move between places; drive duration = distance(from,to) / truck_speed
Hoists stay at a place and perform lifting, putting down, loading, and unloading
Lifting or putting down durations are 1 time unit
Crates can be stacked on pallets or other crates; crates are surfaces if nothing on them
Distances are directed and given by a distance table
Objective is to minimize total time to achieve desired on relations

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent temporal PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models trucks, hoists, crates, places, durations, numeric fluents, and temporal qualifiers (at start, over all, at end). Ensure actions are scoped to agent types (truck drive actions for trucks, hoist lift/put/load/unload for hoists). Respect the provided speeds, powers, weights, distances, initial state, and the goal. Do not assume facts beyond the given information. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The constraints for truck0 are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}.
The constraints for truck1 are: {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
The constraints for hoist0 are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}.
The constraints for hoist1 are: {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}.
The constraints for hoist2 are: {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated temporal and numeric model, respecting the constraints of each agent and minimizing total time. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
